instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A2141: What is A2141? A2141 is a model number for a 16 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years 2019 with EMC 3347, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-01700..
definitions.820-01700: What is 820-01700? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2141</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Boot problems
threads.message:
Hello,

I have a weird issue. I got a new logic board for a <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2141</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> but it won't boot normally. I've never encountered this. It has 20v and 2-3 amps.
All normal, but i get the "no entry sign" flashing. I can't enter internet recovery or anything.
It does go into DFU mode and I tried to revive and restore it with another mac but it always goes in that "no entry sign" and it flashes that for a while until it reboots itself.
I am stuck. I don't think its hardware related (but i could be wrong). I think I got a logic board that's new and needs to be initialized or something. (that's all i can think of).
Does anyone have any experience with this?
Thank you in advance.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2141</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Boot problems
threads.message:
"I think I got a logic board that's new"
Where?
Apple don't sell boards...

Did you try starting in Internet Recovery mode?
Can you detect its SSD in other Mac, starting in Target Disk mode?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2141</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Boot problems
threads.message:
Thanks for the reply. 

I got the board from a reseller.
Yeah I know it can't be new but... When I got it it came in a weird box with good packaging and a weird serial number and other numbers.
It also had weird brackets holding the sides on the board. 

Yes, I did. It doesn't go into recovery mode at all. 
Neither in Target disk mode. The keyboard is working because SMC reset works and DFU mode works. 
I try to boot off a USB and nothing happens. 
It's just strange. Is there anything else I can try?
Thanks again for your help :)

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2141</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Boot problems
<MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2141</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Boot problems
threads.message:
Yes, it completes. No errors. It shows the lock symbol.
When doing the DFU restore/revive process, it always goes to the "no entry sign" symbol flashing. I basically never see an apple logo. 
It's very strange.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2141</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Boot problems
threads.message:
What exactly means "no entry sign"?
Post a screenshot...

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2141</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Boot problems
threads.message:
Here is the screen shot. 
It is flashing this and I cannot do anything else. 
[ATTACH type="full"]60146[/ATTACH]

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2141</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Boot problems
threads.message:
No idea how did you get this board.
There is a chance to be really new, if came with brackets.
If is the case, then needs AST2 to initialize T2 with serial number and all required stuff.
This can be done only by official Apple ASAP.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2141</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Boot problems
threads.message:
Yeah, that is what I figured. I still have no idea how the reseller got this. 
Thank you so much for the help. 
Maybe I will try and ask apple to help me or something. Let's see how it goes haha!
